meanings.definition: A shape or design cut out of a material, such as paper or cardboard.
meanings.sent1: She made a beautiful butterfly cutout for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed creating various animal cutouts during craft time.
meanings.sent3: The cutout of a dinosaur seemed to come to life as it danced across the page.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared as she transformed a simple cutout into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The cutout of a star shone brightly among the other decorations.

meanings.definition: A hole or opening cut out of a larger piece of material.
meanings.sent1: The cutout in the fence allowed the cat to slip through easily.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a small cutout in the wall where the mouse had escaped.
meanings.sent3: The cutout in the fabric revealed a glimpse of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The cutout in the clouds let the sun peek through for a moment.
meanings.sent5: The cutout in the door provided a view of the garden outside.

meanings.definition: To remove or separate by cutting.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cutout the shape from the paper with precision.
meanings.sent2: He needed to cutout the damaged section of the carpet and replace it.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to cutout the spoiled parts of the fruit salad.
meanings.sent4: The surgeon had to cutout the infected tissue to prevent further spread.
meanings.sent5: He decided to cutout the unnecessary details from the report to make it concise.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has been excluded or removed from a group or situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a cutout in the family portrait after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The cutout from the team left a noticeable gap in their performance.
meanings.sent3: The cutout from the party turned out to be the most talked-about topic.
meanings.sent4: Being the cutout in the conversation made her feel isolated.
meanings.sent5: The cutout from the project made the team rethink their strategy.
